grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 潤滑油【ジュンカツユ】lubricating oil, lubricant, lube
潤色【ジュンショク】rhetorical flourishes
芳醇【ホウジュン】mellow (flavor or fragrance, esp. alcohol), rich, full-bodied, superior
豊潤【ホウジュン】rich and prosperous, luxurious, abundant
kun reading compounds: 潤う【うるおう】to be moist, to be damp, to get wet, to be watered, to profit by, to receive benefits, to receive favors (favours), to become rich, to become at ease financially
潤す【うるおす】to moisten, to wet, to profit, to enrich, to benefit
潤む【うるむ】to be wet, to be moist, to get dim, to become blurred, to get cloudy, to get muddy, to be bleared, to become tear-choked
